alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 7:42PM CST until January 31 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Porter, Humble, Sheldon...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 50.3 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins as homes on Lake Point Drive in the Northshore subdivision begin flooding and roads in the Bellaeu Woods subdivision are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Sunday the stage was 49.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 50.5 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.5 feet on 11/26/1987. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 49.3 Sun 6 pm CST 49.9 48.9 47.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 745 AM CST.
